comment: I wish our class met more than once a week.

She is very nice, but history doesn't come easy to me, so I had a lot of trouble with the class. If you enjoy ancient history, this class is for you.  However, I have no interest in it, so it was hard for me to stay focused on her loooong boring lectures.  Also, she grades your papers like a strict English professor, which seemed a little odd to me

I disagree with previous posts. Yes, there is a lot of material to learn, but she is clear, organized and very helpful, always willing to answer questions. The class really helped understand world history much better.
Horrible. Test were hard and over too much material to study and remember it all. 3 tests on a lot of material and 2 papers. Lecture Lecture Lecture

She was unclear and unhelpful.  This class was taught like a history graduate class might be.  Unless you like tests over 20+ chapters and long essays picked over for grammatical errors, stay away!  I liked history prior to this class.
There are twenty chapters you must to know for one test! so much material covered for only two tests
She is really cool. Helpful, interesting, organized, and HOT. Highly recommend the class to anybody who has to take the World History.

THE CLASS ITSELF ISNOT HARD,HER TEST CAN BE SOMEWHAT UNCLEAR AND SHE TEST ALOT OF CHAPTERS AT ONCE. OVERALL IF U GO TO CLASS AND STUDY IN ADVANCE U WILL PASS. SHOW HER YOU TRY AND SHE WILL LOOK OUT FOR YOU IN THE END

She is the worst teacher I have ever had!!  It seemed as though she was more interested in how many people she could get to drop the class, rather than teaching.  It is pretty bad when she lectures from a piece of paper and people in the class know more abouth the subject than she does.
She's so cool: fun, clear, demanding but fair. You put in the work and you learn; no nasty surprises there. Also, she is very, very hot. Just don't forget yourself daydreaming.

She holds grudges against students, namely me.  I can honestly say if you don't get on her bad side, you stand a chance.  Know that she is anal about locations of events in history, not just the actual event.

Everything on the test comes strictly from her notes. The book is a great source to get familiar with the maps but not really necessary because the maps can be accessed through the website for students. Also, the book has very short chapters.
